title: Secondary 1 Mathematics - Chapter 1
topic: Advanced LCM & HCF - Perfect Squares & Cubes
subject: Mathematics

questions.question: What is the smallest integer that should be multiplied with 12 to make it a perfect square?
questions.explanation: Prime factors of 12 = 2² × 3¹. To make a perfect square, each prime factor needs an even exponent. 3 needs one more 3, so multiply by 3: 2² × 3² = 36 (perfect square).

questions.question: What is the smallest integer that should be multiplied with 54 to get a perfect cube?
questions.explanation: Prime factors of 54 = 2¹ × 3³. For a perfect cube, exponents must be multiples of 3. 2¹ needs two more 2s (to make 2³), so multiply by 2² = 4: 2³ × 3³ = 216 (perfect cube).

questions.question: Find the smallest integer that should be multiplied with 180 to make it a perfect square.
questions.explanation: 180 = 2² × 3² × 5¹. 5 has exponent 1 (odd), so needs one more 5 to make exponent 2. Multiply by 5: 2² × 3² × 5² = 900 (30²).

questions.question: What is the smallest integer to multiply with 48 to get a multiple of 90?
questions.explanation: Find LCM of 48 and 90. 48 = 2⁴ × 3, 90 = 2 × 3² × 5. LCM = 2⁴ × 3² × 5 = 720. 720 ÷ 48 = 15. So multiply 48 by 15 to get 720 (multiple of 90).

questions.question: Find the smallest integer that should be divided from 108 to get a perfect square.
questions.explanation: 108 = 2² × 3³. For perfect square, all exponents must be even. 3³ has odd exponent, divide by 3 to get 2² × 3² = 36 (perfect square).

questions.question: What smallest integer should be multiplied with 392 to make it a perfect cube?
questions.explanation: 392 = 2³ × 7². For perfect cube, exponents must be multiples of 3. 7² needs one more 7 to make 7³. Multiply by 7: 2³ × 7³ = 2744 (14³).

What is the smallest integer that should be multiplied with 250 to make it a perfect square?
questions.explanation: 250 = 2 × 5³. For perfect square, exponents must be even. 2¹ needs one more 2, 5³ needs one more 5. Multiply by 2 × 5 = 10: 2² × 5⁴ = 62500 (250²).
